title: LaTeX Tutorials 1
text:
1 Welcome
This website offers a series of tutorials on LaTeX. Use the navigation menu to explore:

LaTeX Basics
Advanced LaTeX Techniques

Սա հայերենի կտորը ու մե հրաշք թեորեմ։ - ՀայՏեխ

title: 2  Armenian
text:
2.2 Տիկո նայի ինչեր եմ կարում։






Չինական գնացքների թեորեմ




2.2.1 LaTeX of Chinese Remainder Theorem
\[
\begin{aligned}
&x \equiv a_1 \ (\text{mod} \ n_1) \\
&x \equiv a_2 \ (\text{mod} \ n_2) \\
&\vdots \\
&x \equiv a_k \ (\text{mod} \ n_k)
\end{aligned}
\]


2.2.2 R Code

chinese_remainder <- function(a, n) {
  N <- prod(n)
  sum(a * (N / n) * sapply(N / n, function(x) solve(x, 1) %% x)) %% N
}

title: 3  LaTeX Basics
text:
4 LaTeX Basics Tutorial
Welcome to the basics of LaTeX. In this tutorial, we cover: - How to write simple documents. - Basic text formatting. - Inserting equations.

title: 3  LaTeX Basics
text:
4.1 Example Equation
Below is a simple equation written in LaTeX:
\[
E = mc^2
\]
Experiment with different LaTeX commands to get familiar with document formatting.

title: 4  Advanced LaTeX Techniques
text:
5 Advanced LaTeX Tutorial
This tutorial explores advanced LaTeX features including: - Custom commands and environments. - Package management. - Creating custom templates.

title: 4  Advanced LaTeX Techniques
text:
5.1 Custom Command Example
You can define a new command in LaTeX as follows:
\newcommand{\R}{\mathbb{R}}
Now, you can use \(\R\) to denote the set of real numbers.
Try incorporating more advanced packages and settings to enhance your document’s design.
